div.p: title: Patient Impact and Hospital Capacity
jurisdiction: United States of America (Details : {urn:iso:std:iso:3166 code 'US' = 'United States of America)

definition: Ventilator : Any device used to support, assist or control respiration (inclusive of the weaning period) through the application of positive pressure to the airway when delivered via an artificial airway, specifically an oral/nasal endotracheal or tracheostomy tube. Note: Ventilation and lung expansion devices that deliver positive pressure to the airway (for example: CPAP, BiPAP, bi-level, IPPB and PEEP) via non-invasive means (for example: nasal prongs, nasal mask, full face mask, total mask, etc.) are not considered ventilators unless positive pressure is delivered via an artificial airway (oral/nasal endotracheal or tracheostomy tube).
Beds : Baby beds in mom's room count as 1 bed, even if there are multiple baby beds Follow-up in progress if staffed is less than licensed. Total includes all beds, even if with surge beds it exceeds licensed beds.
ICU beds : Include NICU (from CDC Webinar 31-Mar-2020) (outstanding question on burn unit)

blockquote.p: code: Hospital Bed Reporting (Details : {http://hl7.org/fhir/us/saner/CodeSystem/GroupSystem code 'Beds' = 'Beds', given as 'Hospital Beds'})

code: Total number of all Inpatient and outpatient beds, including all staffed,ICU, licensed, and overflow (surge) beds used for inpatients or outpatients (Details : {http://hl7.org/fhir/us/saner/CodeSystem/PopulationSystem code 'numTotBeds' = 'All Hospital Beds', given as 'All Hospital Beds'}; {http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/measure-population code 'initial-population' = 'Initial Population)

description: Enter the total number of all hospital beds, including inpatient and outpatient beds. All staffed, licensed, and overflow and surge/expansion beds used for inpatients or outpatients. This includes ICU beds.
criteria:

code: Inpatient beds, including all staffed, licensed, and overflow (surge) beds used for inpatients (Details : {http://hl7.org/fhir/us/saner/CodeSystem/PopulationSystem code 'numBeds' = 'Hospital Inpatient Beds', given as 'Hospital Inpatient Beds'}; {http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/measure-population code 'measure-population' = 'Measure Population)

description: Required. Enter the total number of all inpatient beds, including all staffed, licensed, and overflow and surge/expansion beds created for inpatient care. This includes intensive care unit (ICU) beds.
criteria:

code: Total number of staffed inpatient beds that are occupied (Details : {http://hl7.org/fhir/us/saner/CodeSystem/PopulationSystem code 'numBedsOcc' = 'Hospital Inpatient Bed Occupancy', given as 'Hospital Inpatient Bed Occupancy'}; {http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/measure-population code 'measure-population' = 'Measure Population)

description: Enter the total number of staffed inpatient beds occupied by patients at the time the data is collected, including all staffed, licensed, and overflow and surge/expansion beds created for inpatient care. This includes ICU beds.
CDC Webinar 31-Mar-2020: Baby beds in mom's room count as 1 bed, even if there are multiple baby beds Follow-up in progress if staffed is less than licensed. Total includes all beds, even if with surge beds it exceeds licensed beds.
criteria:

code: Total number of staffed inpatient intensive care unit (ICU) beds (Details : {http://hl7.org/fhir/us/saner/CodeSystem/PopulationSystem code 'numICUBeds' = 'ICU Beds', given as 'ICU Beds'}; {http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/measure-population code 'measure-population' = 'Measure Population)

description: Enter the total number of staffed Intensive Care Unit (ICU) beds.
CDC Webinar 31-Mar-2020: ICU beds include NICU
criteria:

code: Total number of staffed inpatient intensive care unit (ICU) beds (Details : {http://hl7.org/fhir/us/saner/CodeSystem/PopulationSystem code 'numICUBedsOcc' = 'ICU Bed Occupancy', given as 'Total number of staffed inpatient intensive care unit (ICU) beds'}; {http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/measure-population code 'measure-population' = 'Measure Population)

description: Enter the total number of staffed ICU beds occupied by patients at the time the data is collected.
CDC Webinar 31-Mar-2020: ICU beds include NICU
criteria:
code: Hospital Ventilators Reporting (Details : {http://hl7.org/fhir/us/saner/CodeSystem/GroupSystem code 'Ventilators' = 'Ventilators', given as 'Hospital Ventilators'})

code: Total number of ventilators available (Details : {http://hl7.org/fhir/us/saner/CodeSystem/PopulationSystem code 'numVent' = 'Mechanical Ventilators', given as 'Mechanical Ventilators'}; {http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/measure-population code 'initial-population' = 'Initial Population)

description: Enter the total number of mechanical ventilators, including anesthesia machines and portable/transport ventilators available in the facility. Include BiPAP machines if the hospital uses BiPAP to deliver positive pressure ventilation via artificial airways.
criteria:

code: Total number of ventilators in use (Details : {http://hl7.org/fhir/us/saner/CodeSystem/PopulationSystem code 'numVentUse' = 'Mechanical Ventilators in Use', given as 'Mechanical Ventilators in Use'}; {http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/measure-population code 'measure-population' = 'Measure Population)

description: Enter the total number of mechanical ventilators use at the time the data is collected, including anesthesia machines and portable/transport ventilators. Include BiPAP machines if the hospital uses BiPAP to deliver positive pressure ventilation via artificial airways.
criteria:
code: Hospital COVID-19 Encounters Reporting (Details : {http://hl7.org/fhir/us/saner/CodeSystem/GroupSystem code 'Encounters' = 'Encounters', given as 'Encounters'})

code: Patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 in any location. (Details : {http://hl7.org/fhir/us/saner/CodeSystem/PopulationSystem code 'numC19Pats' = 'All COVID-19 Confirmed or Suspected Patients', given as 'All COVID-19 Confirmed or Suspected Patients'}; {http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/measure-population code 'initial-population' = 'Initial Population)

description: Enter the number of patients in any location at the time the data is collected who have suspected or confirmed COVID-19. This includes the patients with laboratory-confirmed or clinically diagnosed COVID-19. Confirmed: A patient with a laboratory confirmed COVID-19 diagnosis Suspected: A patient without a laboratory confirmed COVID-19 diagnosis who, in accordance with CDC’s Interim Public Health Guidance for Evaluating Persons Under Investigation (PUIs), has signs and symptoms compatible with COVID-19 (most patients with confirmed COVID-19 have developed fever and/or symptoms of acute respiratory illness, such as cough, shortness of breath or myalgia/fatigue).
criteria:

code: Patients in any location who have suspected or confirmed COVID-19 and are currently on a ventilator. (Details : {http://hl7.org/fhir/us/saner/CodeSystem/PopulationSystem code 'numC19VentPats' = 'Ventilated COVID-19 Patients', given as 'COVID-19 Patients on a Ventilator'}; {http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/measure-population code 'measure-population' = 'Measure Population)

description: Enter the number of patients in any location who have suspected or confirmed COVID-19 and are currently on a mechanical ventilator* at the time the data is collected. This includes the patients with laboratory-confirmed or clinically diagnosed COVID-19.
criteria:

code: Patients currently hospitalized in an inpatient care location who have suspected or confirmed COVID-19 (Details : {http://hl7.org/fhir/us/saner/CodeSystem/PopulationSystem code 'numC19HospPats' = 'Hospitalized COVID-19 Patients', given as 'Hospitalized COVID-19 Patients'}; {http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/measure-population code 'measure-population' = 'Measure Population)

description: Enter the number of patients hospitalized in an inpatient bed at the time the data is collected who have suspected or confirmed COVID-19. This includes the patients with laboratory-confirmed or clinically diagnosed COVID-19. Confirmed: A patient with a laboratory confirmed COVID-19 diagnosis Suspected: A patient without a laboratory confirmed COVID-19 diagnosis who, in accordance with CDC’s Interim Public Health Guidance for Evaluating Persons Under Investigation (PUIs), has signs and symptoms compatible with COVID-19 (most patients with confirmed COVID-19 have developed fever and/or symptoms of acute respiratory illness, such as cough, shortness of breath or myalgia/fatigue).
criteria:

code: Patients currently hospitalized in an inpatient bed who have suspected or confirmed COVID-19 and are on a mechanical ventilator (Details : {http://hl7.org/fhir/us/saner/CodeSystem/PopulationSystem code 'numC19MechVentPats' = 'Hospitalized and Ventilated COVID-19 Patients', given as 'Hospitalized and Ventilated COVID-19 Patients'}; {http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/measure-population code 'measure-population' = 'Measure Population)

description: Enter the number of patients hospitalized in an inpatient bed who have suspected or confirmed COVID-19 and are currently on a mechanical ventilator* at the time the data is collected . This includes the patients with laboratory-confirmed or clinically diagnosed COVID-19.
criteria:

code: Patients currently hospitalized in an inpatient bed with onset of suspected or confirmed COVID-19 fourteen or more days after hospital admission due to a condition other than COVID-19 (Details : {http://hl7.org/fhir/us/saner/CodeSystem/PopulationSystem code 'numC19HOPats' = 'Hospital Onset COVID-19 Patients', given as 'Hospital Onset COVID-19 Patients'}; {http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/measure-population code 'measure-population' = 'Measure Population)

description: Enter the number of patients hospitalized in an inpatient bed at the time the data is collected with onset of suspected or confirmed COVID-19 fourteen or more days after hospitalization (admission date = hospital day 1). This includes laboratory-confirmed or clinically diagnosed COVID-19 cases.
criteria:

code: Patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 who are currently in the Emergency Department (ED) or any overflow location awaiting an inpatient bed (Details : {http://hl7.org/fhir/us/saner/CodeSystem/PopulationSystem code 'numC19OverflowPats' = 'ED/Overflow COVID-19 Patients', given as 'ED/Overflow COVID-19 Patients'}; {http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/measure-population code 'measure-population' = 'Measure Population)

description: Enter the number of patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 who are in the Emergency Department(ED) or any overflow/expansion location awaiting placement in an inpatient bed at the time the data is collected . This includes patients with laboratory-confirmed or clinically diagnosed COVID-19. Overflow locations include any physical locations created to accommodate patients include but not limited to 24-hour observation units, hallways, parking lots, or tents.
criteria:

code: Patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 who currently are in the ED or any overflow location awaiting an inpatient bed and on a mechanical ventilator (Details : {http://hl7.org/fhir/us/saner/CodeSystem/PopulationSystem code 'numC19OFMechVentPats' = 'ED/Overflow and Ventilated COVID-19 Patients', given as 'ED/Overflow and Ventilated COVID-19 Patients'}; {http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/measure-population code 'measure-population' = 'Measure Population)

description: Enter the number of patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 who are in the ED or any overflow/expansion location on a mechanical ventilator* at the time the data is collected . This includes patients with laboratory-confirmed or clinically diagnosed COVID-19.
criteria:

code: Patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 who died in the hospital, ED or any overflow location on the date for which you are reporting. (Details : {http://hl7.org/fhir/us/saner/CodeSystem/PopulationSystem code 'numC19Died' = 'COVID-19 Patient Deaths', given as 'COVID-19 Patient Deaths'}; {http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/measure-population code 'measure-population' = 'Measure Population)

description: Enter the number of patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 who died in the hospital, ED, or any overflow location. This includes patients with laboratory-confirmed or clinically diagnosed COVID-19. Please enter the count of deaths newly occurred, at the time the data is collected instead of the cumulated number of deaths.
criteria:

name.value: Centers for Disease Control/National Healthcare Safety Network (CDC/NHSN)

display.value: CDC/NHSN COVID-19 Patient Impact & Hospital Capacity Module Home Page

label.value: How to import COVID-19 Summary Data

display.value: Importing COVID-19 Patient Module Denominator data for Patient Safety Component
Instructions for Completion of the COVID-19 Patient Impact and Hospital Capacity Module Form (CDC 57.130)
CDC/NHSN COVID-19 Reporting CSV File Template

definition.value:
Ventilator : Any device used to support, assist or control respiration (inclusive of the weaning period) through the application of positive pressure to the airway when delivered via an artificial airway, specifically an oral/nasal endotracheal or tracheostomy tube. Note: Ventilation and lung expansion devices that deliver positive pressure to the airway (for example: CPAP, BiPAP, bi-level, IPPB and PEEP) via non-invasive means (for example: nasal prongs, nasal mask, full face mask, total mask, etc.) are not considered ventilators unless positive pressure is delivered via an artificial airway (oral/nasal endotracheal or tracheostomy tube).
Beds : Baby beds in mom's room count as 1 bed, even if there are multiple baby beds Follow-up in progress if staffed is less than licensed. Total includes all beds, even if with surge beds it exceeds licensed beds.
ICU beds : Include NICU (from CDC Webinar 31-Mar-2020) (outstanding question on burn unit)

text.value: Total number of all Inpatient and outpatient beds, including all staffed,ICU, licensed, and overflow (surge) beds used for inpatients or outpatients

description.value: Enter the total number of all hospital beds, including inpatient and outpatient beds. All staffed, licensed, and overflow and surge/expansion beds used for inpatients or outpatients. This includes ICU beds.
A bed in any location

text.value: Inpatient beds, including all staffed, licensed, and overflow (surge) beds used for inpatients

description.value: Required. Enter the total number of all inpatient beds, including all staffed, licensed, and overflow and surge/expansion beds created for inpatient care. This includes intensive care unit (ICU) beds.
A Bed where the location is an inpatient location.

text.value: Total number of staffed inpatient beds that are occupied

description.value:
Enter the total number of staffed inpatient beds occupied by patients at the time the data is collected, including all staffed, licensed, and overflow and surge/expansion beds created for inpatient care. This includes ICU beds.
CDC Webinar 31-Mar-2020: Baby beds in mom's room count as 1 bed, even if there are multiple baby beds Follow-up in progress if staffed is less than licensed. Total includes all beds, even if with surge beds it exceeds licensed beds.
An Inpatient Bed where the Bed is occupied.

text.value: Total number of staffed inpatient intensive care unit (ICU) beds

description.value:
Enter the total number of staffed Intensive Care Unit (ICU) beds.
CDC Webinar 31-Mar-2020: ICU beds include NICU
A Bed where the location is an inpatient ICU location.

display.value: Total number of staffed inpatient intensive care unit (ICU) beds

text.value: Total number of staffed inpatient intensive care unit (ICU) beds

description.value:
Enter the total number of staffed ICU beds occupied by patients at the time the data is collected.
CDC Webinar 31-Mar-2020: ICU beds include NICU
An ICU Bed that is occupied.

Enter the total number of mechanical ventilators, including anesthesia machines and portable/transport ventilators available in the facility. Include BiPAP machines if the hospital uses BiPAP to deliver positive pressure ventilation via artificial airways.
A Device that is used for ventilation and could be used (e.g., not broken, transferred, etc)

text.value: Total number of ventilators in use

description.value: Enter the total number of mechanical ventilators use at the time the data is collected, including anesthesia machines and portable/transport ventilators. Include BiPAP machines if the hospital uses BiPAP to deliver positive pressure ventilation via artificial airways.
A ventilator that is attached to a patient.

display.value: All COVID-19 Confirmed or Suspected Patients

text.value: Patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 in any location.

description.value: Enter the number of patients in any location at the time the data is collected who have suspected or confirmed COVID-19. This includes the patients with laboratory-confirmed or clinically diagnosed COVID-19. Confirmed: A patient with a laboratory confirmed COVID-19 diagnosis Suspected: A patient without a laboratory confirmed COVID-19 diagnosis who, in accordance with CDC’s Interim Public Health Guidance for Evaluating Persons Under Investigation (PUIs), has signs and symptoms compatible with COVID-19 (most patients with confirmed COVID-19 have developed fever and/or symptoms of acute respiratory illness, such as cough, shortness of breath or myalgia/fatigue).
ctive encounters where the encounter diagnosis is suspected or confirmed COVID-19, or a Condition of suspected or confirmed COVID-19 was created during that encounter.

expression.value: ncounter.where(clinicalStatus = 'active' and diagnosis.condition.ofType(Condition).code in %ValueSet-SuspectedOrDiagnosedCOVID19) | Encounter.where(clinicalStatus = "active" and Condition.where(code in %ValueSet-SuspectedOrDiagnosedCOVID19).encounter = $this)

text.value: Patients in any location who have suspected or confirmed COVID-19 and are currently on a ventilator.

description.value: Enter the number of patients in any location who have suspected or confirmed COVID-19 and are currently on a mechanical ventilator* at the time the data is collected. This includes the patients with laboratory-confirmed or clinically diagnosed COVID-19.
A COVID-19 encounter where the patient is ventilated

text.value: Patients currently hospitalized in an inpatient care location who have suspected or confirmed COVID-19

description.value: Enter the number of patients hospitalized in an inpatient bed at the time the data is collected who have suspected or confirmed COVID-19. This includes the patients with laboratory-confirmed or clinically diagnosed COVID-19. Confirmed: A patient with a laboratory confirmed COVID-19 diagnosis Suspected: A patient without a laboratory confirmed COVID-19 diagnosis who, in accordance with CDC’s Interim Public Health Guidance for Evaluating Persons Under Investigation (PUIs), has signs and symptoms compatible with COVID-19 (most patients with confirmed COVID-19 have developed fever and/or symptoms of acute respiratory illness, such as cough, shortness of breath or myalgia/fatigue).
An COVID-19 encounter where the active location is an inpatient location

text.value: Patients currently hospitalized in an inpatient bed who have suspected or confirmed COVID-19 and are on a mechanical ventilator

description.value: Enter the number of patients hospitalized in an inpatient bed who have suspected or confirmed COVID-19 and are currently on a mechanical ventilator* at the time the data is collected . This includes the patients with laboratory-confirmed or clinically diagnosed COVID-19.
An COVID-19 encounter in an inpatient setting on a ventilator

text.value: Patients currently hospitalized in an inpatient bed with onset of suspected or confirmed COVID-19 fourteen or more days after hospital admission due to a condition other than COVID-19

description.value: Enter the number of patients hospitalized in an inpatient bed at the time the data is collected with onset of suspected or confirmed COVID-19 fourteen or more days after hospitalization (admission date = hospital day 1). This includes laboratory-confirmed or clinically diagnosed COVID-19 cases.
Encounters associated with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 with onset > 14 days after start

expression.value: dition.where( code in %ValueSet-SuspectedOrDiagnosedCOVID19 and encounter in %numC19HospPats and onset + 14 days > encounter.period.start).encounter

text.value: Patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 who are currently in the Emergency Department (ED) or any overflow location awaiting an inpatient bed

description.value: Enter the number of patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 who are in the Emergency Department(ED) or any overflow/expansion location awaiting placement in an inpatient bed at the time the data is collected . This includes patients with laboratory-confirmed or clinically diagnosed COVID-19. Overflow locations include any physical locations created to accommodate patients include but not limited to 24-hour observation units, hallways, parking lots, or tents.
An COVID-19 encounter where the active location is an ED or Overflow location

text.value: Patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 who currently are in the ED or any overflow location awaiting an inpatient bed and on a mechanical ventilator

description.value: Enter the number of patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 who are in the ED or any overflow/expansion location on a mechanical ventilator* at the time the data is collected . This includes patients with laboratory-confirmed or clinically diagnosed COVID-19.
An COVID-19 encounter where the active location is an ED or Overflow location

text.value: Patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 who died in the hospital, ED or any overflow location on the date for which you are reporting.

description.value: Enter the number of patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 who died in the hospital, ED, or any overflow location. This includes patients with laboratory-confirmed or clinically diagnosed COVID-19. Please enter the count of deaths newly occurred, at the time the data is collected instead of the cumulated number of deaths.
All C19 Patients who have died in an encounter during the reporting period.
